name: chokuto
description: A re-creation of an ancient Japanese straight-sword; often considered the predecessor to the tachi and later the uchigatana and katana; this is a straight-edged broadsword with a design similar to the jian and the piandao, but with a traditional Japanese-edge and handle; its lightweight, extended handle, and subtly-long length make it an excellent cutting weapon for sword-dancers and more dexterous sword-fighters. It can be wielded with one or two hands. /“Please, don’t call it a ninja-sword.” This particular replica shows impressive craftsmanship and is ready for combat./

name: phasing chokuto (unactive)
description: A re-creation of an ancient japanese straight-sword; its lightweight, extended handle, and subtly-long length make it an excellent cutting weapon for sword-dancers and more dexterous sword-fighters. This particular model has a conducter built into the hilt with two high-powered oscillators built into the hilt, these oscilliators disperse micro-vibrations up to frequencies as high as 50Ghz directly into the blade, practically 'obliterating' biological and even some forms of synthetic matter on even a microscopic level. This isn't your fancy turkey cutter.
